stories.text:
I can solve simple sudoku, well everyone can I guess. But when it comes to difficult levels, I fail. And I have never been able to solve a Rubik's cube.

My question is - can people solve these without any training or knowlegde of tricks or actual methods to solve them? Am I banging my head at the wrong wall? Should I learn about the methodology or is an average person supposed to solve these without any training?
stories.title: Ask HN: Is it possible to solve Sudoku or Rubik's Cube without training

stories.text:
I want to learn Algorithms & Data Structures from scratch then move on to doing LeetCode.

But I want a structured guide / textbook that I can follow which also contains exercises.

I have checked the CLRS book, but, it's more of a reference than a book that you can read from cover to cover. For example a basic Stack is explained in a page and a half or two, for me this is not enough, I want a book that can go into the details of each specific DS or Algorirhm.

*TL;DR:* Are there any books better than CLRS for DS & Algos?
stories.title: Ask HN: Looking for a Book on Algorithms and Data Structures
Can we use big batteries to power our trains?

stories.text:
Dear people of computer science (and related fields) who love their job. I'd appreciate if you can share your experience regarding the following:

How do you define your role?

What do you love about the work you do?

What part of your work are you surprised you love today?

Which part of work affects your passion? Things which are part of your responsibilities and/or things which are enabled by certain properties of your work place?

What would you advise your past self towards the end of your studies and before/at the beginning of your career?

Which role do you find interesting today and haven't heard about during your studies?
stories.title: Ask HN: People of Comp-Sci and related who love their job. What do you do?

stories.text:
I have been using my phone for about 3 years. It has become slower and slower. In the beginning, everything opens instantly. Now, it literally takes 10 seconds just to open Chrome. I quit all the applications after I am done with them. In that case, I don't understand. What is making my phone less responsive?

(I tried to lookup, but all I got are some weird claims from some shady news websites about battery dying or system updates, which does not really make sense to me.)
stories.title: Ask HN: Why do Android phones become slower?
